pr_title: chore(api) remove JAVA_DATE since codegen does not generate java.lang.Date

timeline.message: chore(api) remove JAVA_DATE since this is not a type that codegen will ever translate

timeline.bodyText:
This is a bit of a hack because I cannot reference Temporal.Date.class from here, since it is in the aws-api-appsync module, which I can't reference from core, so I have to get it using reflection.   A better solution for another day could be to move ModelSchema (and other related Model classes) from core to aws-api-appsync.
Previously, this test was only passing by coincidence - it was comparing java.lang.Date.class.getSimpleName() with the Temporal.Date.class.getSimpleName(), and it passed since they are equal.  Now that we are comparing the actual class, this test started failing (as it should), so this needs to be updated to actually reference the correct Class.
timeline.author: richardmcclellan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,7 +70,7 @@ public void modelSchemaIsGeneratedForPersonModel() throws AmplifyException {
         expectedFields.put("dob", ModelField.builder()
             .targetType("AWSDate")
             .name("dob")
-            .type(Date.class)
+            .type(Class.forName("com.amplifyframework.core.model.temporal.Temporal$Date"))

replies.bodyText:
aws-api-appsync module, which I can't reference from core

Certainly not from src code. But what about as a testImplementation?
You could also access it through the testutils module, perhaps -- an additional level of indirection?
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.message: Avoid reflection by adding testImplementation dependency on aws-api-appsync

timeline.bodyText: The ClassNotFoundException has gone away now, too.
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams
